question_stem.en: A 36-year-old man comes to the office for follow-up regarding hepatitis C. The patient was last seen 3 years ago for a 2-week history of fatigue, nausea, and decreased appetite; at that time, he was diagnosed with hepatitis C infection due to injection drug use. The patient was offered treatment but declined. He is currently healthy and feels well. There is no family history of liver disease. The patient currently does not use illicit drugs or alcohol. Vital signs are normal. BMI is 26 kg/m². Examination is normal. Laboratory results are as follows: {{exhibit_1}} Liver ultrasound is negative for cirrhosis or masses. If a liver biopsy is performed, which of the following histologic findings would most likely be present in this patient?
question_stem.zh: 一名36岁的男性前来就诊，随访乙型肝炎。患者上次就诊是在3年前，当时有2周的疲劳、恶心和食欲下降病史；当时，他被诊断为乙型肝炎感染，病因是注射毒品。患者曾被提供治疗，但拒绝了。他目前很健康，感觉良好。没有肝病家族史。患者目前不使用非法药物或酒精。生命体征正常。BMI为26 kg/m²。检查结果正常。实验室检查结果如下：{{exhibit_1}} 肝脏超声未发现肝硬化或肿块。如果进行肝活检，患者最有可能出现以下哪种组织学发现？

question.en: Which of the following histologic findings would most likely be present in this patient?
question.zh: 患者最有可能出现以下哪种组织学发现？

A.en: Dilated sinusoids with clumped red blood cells
A.zh: 窦状隙扩张伴有红细胞聚集

B.en: Dysplastic hepatocytes in small clusters and rows
B.zh: 小簇和排中的异型增生肝细胞

C.zh: 上皮样肉芽肿伴有显著纤维化

D.en: Large amount of brown to black pigment in hepatocytes
D.zh: 肝细胞内存在大量棕黑色色素

explanation.en:
This patient has chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV), which is confirmed with positive tests for anti-HCV antibodies and HCV RNA. Intravenous drug users, those who engage in high-risk sexual behavior, patients receiving hemodialysis, and individuals with inadvertent blood exposure are at increased risk. 

Acute HCV, lasting approximately 6 months after initial infection, is characterized by negative anti-HCV antibodies and positive HCV RNA. Histologic findings are similar to those of other acute viral hepatitides and include panlobular lymphocytic inflammation (ie, inflammation involving entire lobule) and hepatocyte injury (eg, ballooning degeneration), which may lead to cell death (eg, necrosis, apoptosis [ie, Councilman body]).

Most cases (~80%) progress to chronic HCV, which is predominantly characterized by portal tract-based lymphocytic infiltration, including lymphoid follicles, and fibrosis. Chronic inflammation causes persistent hepatocyte injury and can involve the hepatocytes adjacent to the portal tracts (ie, interface activity). After several decades, chronic HCV can progress to cirrhosis characterized by abnormal hepatic architecture with extensive fibrosis and the formation of bridging fibrous septa that surround regenerative parenchymal nodules. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}} {{exhibit_8}} {{exhibit_9}}

(Choice A) Congestive hepatopathy results from right-sided heart failure and increased hydrostatic pressure within hepatic sinusoids, which dilate due to the intraluminal accumulation of clumped red blood cells. This predominantly affects the centrilobular regions of the liver and may cause necrosis.

(Choice B) Hepatocellular carcinoma is characterized by dysplastic hepatocytes arranged in clusters and thickened rows. Although it can develop in patients with HCV-related cirrhosis, it is usually identified by ultrasound, which was negative in this patient.

(Choice C) Hepatic sarcoidosis is characterized by aggregates of epithelioid cells (ie, activated macrophages) forming granulomas; when severe, fibrosis and cirrhosis can occur.

(Choice D) Dubin-Johnson syndrome impairs the ability of hepatocytes to excrete conjugated bilirubin into bile canaliculi. The liver grossly appears black, and microscopy shows large amounts of dark brown to black pigment within hepatocyte lysosomes.

Educational objective: Acute hepatitis C is characterized by panlobular lymphocytic inflammation with hepatocyte injury (eg, ballooning degeneration) and cell death (eg, Councilman bodies). Chronic hepatitis C leads predominantly to portal lymphocytic infiltration, including lymphoid follicle formation, and fibrosis. Histologic findings of cirrhosis include extensive fibrosis and the formation of bridging septa that surround regenerative nodules.
explanation.zh:
该患者患有慢性丙型肝炎病毒（HCV），这通过抗HCV抗体和HCV RNA阳性检测得到证实。静脉吸毒者、从事高危性行为者、接受血液透析的患者以及意外暴露于血液的个体，其风险增加。

急性HCV，持续时间约为初始感染后的6个月，其特征是抗HCV抗体阴性，HCV RNA阳性。组织学发现与其他急性病毒性肝炎相似，包括全小叶淋巴细胞性炎症（即，涉及整个小叶的炎症）和肝细胞损伤（例如，气球样变性），这可能导致细胞死亡（例如，坏死、细胞凋亡[即，Councilman小体]）。

大多数病例（约80%）进展为慢性HCV，其主要特征是基于门管区的淋巴细胞浸润，包括淋巴滤泡和纤维化。慢性炎症导致持续的肝细胞损伤，并可累及毗邻门管区的肝细胞（即，界面活动）。数十年后，慢性HCV可进展为肝硬化，其特征是肝脏结构异常，伴有广泛的纤维化和包绕再生实质结节的桥接纤维间隔的形成。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}} {{exhibit_8}} {{exhibit_9}}

(选项A) 淤血性肝病是由右心衰竭和肝窦内静水压升高引起的，由于腔内聚集的红细胞，肝窦扩张。这主要影响肝脏的中央小叶区域，并可能导致坏死。

(选项B) 肝细胞癌的特征是排列成簇和增厚的排的异型增生肝细胞。虽然它可以在HCV相关肝硬化的患者中发展，但通常通过超声识别，该患者超声结果为阴性。

(选项C) 肝结节病以形成肉芽肿的上皮样细胞（即，活化的巨噬细胞）聚集为特征；当严重时，可发生纤维化和肝硬化。

(选项D) Dubin-Johnson综合征损害肝细胞将结合胆红素排泄到胆管中的能力。肝脏肉眼观呈黑色，镜检显示肝细胞溶酶体内存在大量深棕色至黑色色素。

教育目标：急性丙型肝炎的特征是全小叶淋巴细胞性炎症伴有肝细胞损伤（例如，气球样变性）和细胞死亡（例如，Councilman小体）。慢性丙型肝炎主要导致门管淋巴细胞浸润，包括淋巴滤泡形成和纤维化。肝硬化的组织学发现包括广泛的纤维化和包绕再生结节的桥接间隔的形成。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the histologic findings associated with chronic hepatitis C infection. Specifically, it assesses the characteristic portal tract-based lymphocytic infiltration seen in liver biopsies of patients with chronic HCV. 

To solve this question, review the patient's history of hepatitis C and the negative liver ultrasound. Recall that chronic HCV is characterized by portal inflammation and fibrosis, leading to the correct answer of lymphocytic infiltration of portal tracts.
summary.zh:
本题考察与慢性丙型肝炎感染相关的组织学发现的知识。具体来说，它评估了在慢性HCV患者的肝活检中看到的特征性门管区淋巴细胞浸润。

要解决这个问题，请回顾患者的丙型肝炎病史和阴性肝脏超声检查。回想一下，慢性HCV的特征是门管炎症和纤维化，导致正确答案，即门管区的淋巴细胞浸润。
